dbmanagement

Class FormatQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbmanagement.FormatQuery

  • public class FormatQuery
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods that performs search and replace operation on a given string. The string is set by setters. Currently methods on this class deals with two types of DBMS dialects SQLOperation and NOSQL. SQLOperation represents mysql,postgres and oracle and NOSQL represents mongodb. * @author Saurab Dahal

      • getFinalQuery

        public java.lang.String getFinalQuery(java.lang.String dbms)
        Parameters:
        dbms - It specifies language. Values can be sql,mongo
        Returns:
        query string with alias being replaced by table

      • extractSqlTables

        private java.util.ArrayList extractSqlTables()
        This is function splits query by white space and compares each token with the words from and join and adds token index plus one key, which in sql is always table, to ArrayList
        Returns:
        ArrayList Containing list of tables

      • extractMongoTables

        private java.util.ArrayList extractMongoTables()
        This is function splits query by dot ( . ) and compares each token with the words db and adds token index plus one key, which in mongo helper is always collection, to ArrayList
        Returns:
        ArrayList Containing list of collections

      • replaceMongo

        private java.lang.String replaceMongo()
        This function replaces alias with table name in the original query. Alias and table name are stored as properties in properties file which is read by @see GetFromProperty#getAlias(). Difference between this method and @see #replaceSql() is that this method works explicitly on Mongo helper query.
        Returns:
        String The alias in original string is replaced by table name.

      • replaceSql

        private java.lang.String replaceSql()
        This function replaces alias with table name in the original query. Alias and table name are stored as properties in properties file which is read by @see GetFromProperty#getAlias() Difference between this method and @see #replaceMongo() is that this method works explicitly on AQL query.
        Returns:
        String The alias in original string is replaced by table name.

      • replaceLimit

        private java.lang.String replaceLimit(java.lang.String str1)
        Replaces limit value greater than 10000 ( Ten Thousand ) to 10000
        Parameters:
        str1 - Query string in which alias name is replaced by table name
        Returns:
        String which has limit value above 10000 is changed.

        private java.lang.String appendLimit(java.lang.String str1)
